Posted By: Gemischt (3/6/2014 2:09:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think that of the two decks, Vraska is going to have more sheer power, especially considering that her -3 can kill Jace directly. Jace players are going to have to get pretty clever, but that's why they're blue mages to begin with, right?  
  
On a side note, Jace's +1 should go a long way to keeping Vraska's Assassin tokens away from your neck, so that's a plus.  
  
Edit: I just realized that if you manage to get Jace's -8 to go off, you can actually cast [Vraska the Unseen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vraska the Unseen) from her own deck. Kind of cool how each Planeswalker's ultimate ability is like an alternate ending to the duel.  
  
**Default Ending: One Planeswalker beats the other, while the loser escapes with their life.  
Alternate Ending 1: Jace uses his mind magic to convert Vraska to his cause, securing peace in Ravnica.  
Alternate Ending 2: Vraska's assassins kill Jace, upsetting the balance in Ravnica forever.**
posts.html:

Alternate Ending 1: Jace uses his mind magic to convert Vraska to his cause, securing peace in Ravnica.
Alternate Ending 2: Vraska's assassins kill Jace, upsetting the balance in Ravnica forever.

posts.post_content:
I don't understand all of the artwork hate! There's not that much in the way of male eye-candy in this game, and it looks great.  
The argument seems to be "He doesn't look like he's on his way to battle" but come on: So many of the female cards look like they're on their way to work at their local \*ahem\* "dance club". What's the problem with a few good-looking guys? ;)
posts.html:
